name: Web Add-In - Deployment Guide for Protect
title: Web Add-In - Deployment Guide for Protect
body:
This guide explains how to deploy the web add-in for your Microsoft 365 users. This solution enhances your organization's security by providing powerful encryption services and delivering real-time guidance when sending emails. It ensures consistent protection throughout your organization, as the add-in will be deployed to all supported devices, including Outlook Web Access (OWA), Mac, and Windows.

Prerequisites

Before you get started, please ensure you have the following:

  • Global admin rights to your organization's Microsoft 365 admin portal
  • Microsoft Outlook JavaScript (JS) API requirement set 1.8 or later
  • A gateway must be provisioned for all Web add-in deployments
  • We recommend that the gateway be configured with a moderation mailbox. See the Gateway Configuration article for more details.
  • Optional: Microsoft 365 or Azure AD group to assign Office JS to a user group

Deployment Steps

  1. Log in to your Microsoft 365 admin portal. 
  2. Navigate to Settings > Integrated apps > Add-ins.

  3. Select I have a URL for the manifest file and paste the URL for the Microsoft add-in manifest file into the field.
    • UK Manifest: https://www.knowbe4.com/hubfs/prod-uk-manifest.xml
    • US Manifest: https://www.knowbe4.com/hubfs/prod-us-manifest.xml
    • EU Manifest: https://www.knowbe4.com/hubfs/prod-eu-manifest.xml
    • AU Manifest: https://www.knowbe4.com/hubfs/prod-au-manifest.xml
  4. Once you select Upload, you will need to select who you want to deploy the application to and how you want to deploy it:
    • Assign Users: Select Specific users/groups and add the chosen users or groups.
    • Deployment Method: Select Optional.
  5. Click Deploy.
  6. A green tick will display when the add-in is deployed. It may take up to 12 hours before the application appears for users.

Allowlisting

To allow the proper functioning of our services, ensure the following URLs are listed on your firewall or proxy:

  • switch.egress.com
  • gc.egress.com

Use the correct URLs for your region:

  • uk.intelligence.egress.com
  • uk.kes.knowbe4.com
  • us.intelligence.egress.com
  • us.kes.knowbe4.com
  • eu.intelligence.egress.com
  • eu.kes.knowbe4.com
  • au.intelligence.egress.com
  • au.kes.knowbe4.com

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface segment for Add-in management, specifically detailing the deployment initiation process.

**Context and Navigation Bar:**
The current section is titled **"Add-ins."** The primary action element, a button labeled **"Deploy Add-In"** (preceded by a plus icon), is visually selected/highlighted. The navigation bar also includes a search function indicated by a magnifying glass icon and the text "Search," alongside a menu icon.

**Deployment Interface:**
Upon activating the "Deploy Add-In" function, a sub-pane or modal titled **"Deploy a new add-in"** appears, offering two distinct deployment options:

1.  **Deployment from the Store:**
    *   **Title:** Deploy from the Store
    *   **Description:** Get solutions tailored to your industry that work with the products you already use.
    *   **Action Button:** Choose from the Store (light gray).

2.  **Deployment of a Custom Add-in:**
    *   **Title:** Deploy a custom add-in
    *   **Description:** Create a new web application, or upload an add-in / integration for Office.
    *   **Action Button:** Upload custom apps (gray, highlighted).
images.context: vigate to Settings > Integrated apps > Add-ins.
